options.name: autoMigrate
options.desc: Whether Kubo should try to run the fs-repo-migration at startup.

options.name: autoMount
options.desc: Whether Kubo should try to mount /ipfs and /ipns at startup.

options.name: dataDir
options.desc: The data dir for Kubo

options.name: defaultMode
options.desc: systemd service that is enabled by default

options.name: emptyRepo
options.desc: If set to false, the repo will be initialized with help files

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable the Interplanetary File System (WARNING: may cause severe network degradation). NOTE: after enabling this option and rebuilding your system, you need to log out and back in for the IPFS_PATH environment variable to be present in your shell. Until you do that, the CLI tools won’t be able to talk to the daemon by default .

options.name: enableGC
options.desc: Whether to enable automatic garbage collection

options.name: extraFlags
options.desc: Extra flags passed to the Kubo daemon

options.name: group
options.desc: Group under which the Kubo daemon runs

options.name: localDiscovery
options.desc: Whether to enable local discovery for the Kubo daemon. This will allow Kubo to scan ports on your local network. Some hosting services will ban you if you do this.

options.name: package
options.desc: The kubo package to use.

options.name: serviceFdlimit
options.desc: The fdlimit for the Kubo systemd unit or null to have the daemon attempt to manage it

options.name: settings
options.desc: Attrset of daemon configuration. See [https://github.com/ipfs/kubo/blob/master/docs/config.md](https://github.com/ipfs/kubo/blob/master/docs/config.md) for reference. You can’t set Identity or Pinning.

options.name: settings.Addresses.API
options.desc: Multiaddr or array of multiaddrs describing the address to serve the local HTTP API on. In addition to the multiaddrs listed here, the daemon will also listen on a Unix domain socket. To allow the ipfs CLI tools to communicate with the daemon over that socket, add your user to the correct group, e.g. users.users.alice.extraGroups = [ config.services.kubo.group ];

options.name: settings.Addresses.Gateway
options.desc: Where the IPFS Gateway can be reached

options.name: settings.Addresses.Swarm
options.desc: Where Kubo listens for incoming p2p connections

options.name: settings.Mounts.IPFS
options.desc: Where to mount the IPFS namespace to

options.name: settings.Mounts.IPNS
options.desc: Where to mount the IPNS namespace to

options.name: startWhenNeeded
options.desc: Whether to use socket activation to start Kubo when needed.

options.name: user
options.desc: User under which the Kubo daemon runs
